items.message:
Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels are falling on the River Thame and Chalgrove Brook but still remain high in the Thame area. Therefore flooding of roads and farmland is expected to continue in the Thame area but the risk of flooding is reducing. 
The weather forecast is for showers this evening. Monday is forecast to start dry with heavy showers developing later. River levels are falling slowly, but still pose a flood risk.
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 25/10/2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is still possible today, Sunday 24th October, and into Monday morning.  Water levels continue to remain high, but are starting to reduce to more normal levels.  These high water levels are due to a natural tide locking effect. High tidal water moving up the rivers from Great Yarmouth, is currently restricting the normal drainage out to sea at low tide, of the Broads river system. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry road in Horning.  We are not currently expecting the situation to escalate, or to issue any further warning messages at this time. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We will continue to monitor the situation. We will update this message by 9am tomorrow, Monday 25th October.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message:
The drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 6.95 m and is slowly decreasing. 
Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.3 m, the road from Muchelney to Long load if this level exceeds 7.86 and the road from Muchelney to Thorney if this level exceeds 7.93 m. Property flooding is possible if this level exceeds 8.35 m.
Pumping is currently taking place at Huish Episcopi pumping station. Relatively dry weather is forecast over the next 24 hours. The River Yeo at Muchelney has been decreasing since Friday, 22/10/21.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.   
This message will be updated by 17:00 on Sunday, 24/10/21, or as the situation changes.

The flood alert has been removed due to improving weather conditions and falling tides. We no longer expect overtopping from waves. Please continue to be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.
The forecast is mainly dry for the first half of next week, however a wetter period is forecast as we move towards the weekend. The ground is still very wet and so rivers will respond more quickly to any rainfall.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

floodArea.county: Bournemouth, Christchurch and Poole, Dorset Council, Hampshire
